abstract: Justice Barbara Jaffe of New York State Supreme Court hears arguments on whether chimpanzees can be considered persons with legal rights; Nonhuman Rights Project sued Stony Brook University to obtain release of Hercules and Leo, two 8-year-old chimpanzees that are being used for research; plaintiffs have attempted to use writ of habeas corpus.
lead_paragraph: The Nonhuman Rights Project hopes to free two chimpanzees at a university on Long Island by arguing they are “autonomous beings,” comparing their plight to that of human slaves.

headline.main: Arguing in Court Whether 2 Chimps Have the Right to ‘Bodily Liberty’
headline.print_headline: Arguing in Court Whether 2 Chimps Have the Right to ‘Bodily Liberty’

snippet: The Nonhuman Rights Project hopes to free two chimpanzees at a university on Long Island by arguing they are “autonomous beings,” comparing their plight to that of human slaves.

keywords.value: State University of New York at Stony Brook
keywords.name: organizations
